days.activity: Almost missed our flight but made it! Monks picked us up

journal.title: Wed 6/18
journal.content:
almost missed our flight thanks to car that broke down in the tunnel. we had to decide to either
-- go home + rebook our flights for the 12:40 the next day, or
-- late check our bags, run through logan to get to our gate in time, and hope that our bags arrive in Chicago before we had to leave for Michigan
- we chose the latter. we made it onto the plane and were shocked to find out when we landed that our bags made it on too! a honeymoon miracle!
- Monks picked us up from the airport and we got our first feeling for how the truck would work

photos.title: Miracle Flight Day
photos.description: From near disaster to honeymoon miracle - our bags made it and our adventure officially began!
highlights: Reunion with our miraculously delivered luggage

album.title: No album today

map.title: Boston Logan to Chicago
map.description: A dramatic start - from car breakdown to flight miracle, landing safely in Chicago for pickup by Monks.

days.activity: Morning with Monks, drive north with cider stop and close call

journal.title: Thurs 6/19
journal.content:
- nice morning with Monks
- Fenn saw Nardwuar
- stopped in Fennville for a cider (thanks to a tip from Monks)
- Fenn narrowly avoided a dog that wandered onto the highway by our motel (scary! another thing that could've derailed the whole trip right at the start!)
- the sun seems reluctant to set up here. darkness doesn't really roll in till ~ 10:15 PM

photos.title: Road Trip North
photos.description: Morning with Monks, celebrity sightings, cider tasting, and dramatic northern Michigan landscapes.

album.title: Sufjan Stevens - Illinois

map.title: Journey to Northern Michigan
map.description: From Chicago through Michigan, including Fennville cider stop and arrival in the Upper Peninsula.

days.activity: Ferry to island, fort exploration, fine dining at Grand Hotel

journal.title: Fri 6/20
journal.content:
- took scenic ferry under Mackinaw Bridge to Mackinac Island
- hiked up to fort, saw rifle display
- both Fenn + I were struck by the East Coast feel of the island
- if it weren't for the lack of salt in the air, you would think we were at the ocean
- tried a pastie for the first time (yooper delicacy)
- hiked around to arch rock, skull cave, sugar loaf, etc
- had an amazing meal (thanks Noni!) at the Jockey Club at the Grand Hotel. The prime rib, short rib, and rye sour were so good!
- the island was deceptively small - we kept over estimating how long our hikes would take
- the decorations at the Grand Hotel were out of this world/of another time. the germanium rug was a stand out

photos.title: Mackinac Island Adventures
photos.description: Ferry rides, fort exploration, natural wonders, and Grand Hotel elegance.

album.title: Mariah Carey - The Emancipation of MiMi

map.title: Mackinac Island Exploration
map.description: Car-free island paradise reached by scenic ferry, featuring historic fort and natural wonders.

days.activity: Heat wave begins, cruise substitutes for canceled kayaking, Marquette exploration

journal.title: Sat 6/21
journal.content:
- start of the heat wave (~90º today)
- thunderstorms + wind advisory in the morning led to the cancellation of our kayak tour. To cope with the disappointment I booked us on a cruise around the Pictured Rocks. Thye were beautiful but I imagine they're more magical via kayak
- Presque Isle Park, watched the jumpers at Black Rock Cove (Fenn thinks this is where they took the album cover picture for the most recent Charmer album)
- experienced downtown Marquette, very cute town, big thing in water
- stopped at Au Train beach, very sandy + beautiful
- Michigan is the most New England-coded state in the midwest

photos.title: Heat Wave Adventures
photos.description: Cruise around Pictured Rocks, Marquette town exploration, and beautiful Lake Superior beaches.

album.title: Liquid Mike - Paul Bunyan's Slingshot

map.title: Upper Peninsula Heat Wave Tour
map.description: From Pictured Rocks cruise to Marquette exploration, making the best of hot weather and plan changes.
highlights: Black Rock Cove (potential Charmer album cover site)

days.activity: Epic drive, Culver's, Porter's Sculpture Garden, thunderstorms

journal.title: Sun 6/22
journal.content:
- "Pancakes in Heaven Thrift Shop"
- Big drive (~14 hours) from Marquette to Kadoka, SD
- My first trip to Culver's, two thumbs up
- Stopped at Porter's Sculpture Garden outside Sioux Falls, SD. Larger than life metal sculptures done by 1 man over 40ish years. Many are accompanied by poems. Both Fenn + I were very moved, they cried and I sobbed.
- went to a pizza place somewhere in SD + I got sauerkraut on a pizza. genius.
- there was about 2 hours between the pizza place and Kadoka. There was a thunderstorm warning + we could see it off in the distance. Eventually we were engulfed by the storm. The rain came down so hard we couldn't see. We pulled over and waited it out. I was scared cause it reminded me of all those storm chaser videos + I was convinced we were gonna be sucked up by a tornado. It was really beautiful though
-- we later learned that this area gets ~11 inches of rain per year

photos.title: Cross-Country Journey
photos.description: Epic 13-14 hour drive across the changing American landscape toward South Dakota.

album.title: True Names compilation

map.title: Michigan to South Dakota
map.description: Epic 13-14 hour cross-country drive with overnight stop in Kadoka, SD.

days.activity: Badlands exploration, Wall Drug, tent camping

journal.title: Mon 6/23
journal.content:
- Badlands National Park
- Hiked the "Door" + "Window"
- Hiked part of the Castle Trail with Medicine Loop. Intellectually, we knew there would be no shade - it's a prairie. But also, we hiked in the heat (~2 PM) with no hats. We're looking and feeling crispy.
- We're able to climb on anything here. It feels like it shouldn't be allowed but everyone is doing it + there's no signs saying not to.
- Finally made it to Wall Drug after 100s of miles of billboards building anticipation
-- food was mid, stores were fun but overwhelming
-- we got free donuts + coffee for being honeymooners
- went to the overlooks for sunset. stunning!
- we also saw big horned sheep :)
- a woman almost fell to her death taking a photo :O
- first night in tent, drank wine + stargazed

photos.title: Badlands Majesty
photos.description: Exploring the dramatic and otherworldly landscape of Badlands National Park.

album.title: Bruce Springsteen - Darkness on the Edge of Town (cuz of Badlands, duh)

map.title: Badlands National Park
map.description: Exploring the dramatic rock formations and camping in South Dakota's Badlands.

days.activity: Saddle Pass hike, Yellow Mound, Airbnb near Devil's Tower

journal.title: Tues 6/24
journal.content:
- did Saddle Pass to Castle Trail -> Fossil Exhibit
-- weird lack of benches
-- _amazing_ rock field with incredible colors of quartz + petrified wood, I didn't take any
-- Saddle Pass was SO steep, I looked so stupid coming down 2 inches at a time. tons of loose rocks, you could slip and just keep going
- climbed around Yellow Mound (yellow from the ocean creatures that were there ~600 million years ago)
- ate good BBQ in Wall
- decided to change plans + get an airbnb for the night a couple hours west due to thunderstorms in Badlands
-- Deadwood Pit Stop - Hilarious tourist trap
--- Bullock hardware store turns into a hotel? is this a spoiler??
- stayed in an airbnb near Devil's Tower. Dawn made blueberry banana bread
-- neighbor gave directions for a scenic from from Glacier

photos.title: Badlands to Devil's Tower
photos.description: Final Badlands exploration and the journey toward Wyoming's iconic Devil's Tower.

album.title: The Beatles - Sgt Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

map.title: Badlands to Devil's Tower
map.description: Final Badlands exploration and drive to Wyoming's Devil's Tower National Monument.

days.activity: Devil's Tower hike, long drive to Glacier Park Lodge

journal.title: Wed 6/25
journal.content:
- arrived at Devil's Tower. Did a short hike around the base. Amazing geology + beautiful surrounding area
- long drive to Glacier National Park. Basically did a long diagonal across Montana
- the "Big Sky" nickname is well earned
- I drove for _5_ hours! Yuck.
- We found probably the only McDonalds desert in America
- Remembered at 6:52 to get Going to the Sun Road tickets at 7 - Fenn got them since I was driving
- arrived at Glacier Park Lodge. Front desk was a bit chaotic + wrong. Told us the restaurant was open until 10 PM but they were closing up when we got there at 9. The drinks we got at the bar were good - lots of huckleberry drinks. We got food to go + ate in the room.

photos.title: Devil's Tower and Journey North
photos.description: Exploring the iconic Devil's Tower and beginning the long drive to Glacier National Park.

album.title: Explosions in the Sky - The Earth is Not a Cold Dead Place

map.title: Devil's Tower to Glacier
map.description: Visiting Devil's Tower National Monument and epic 12-hour drive to Glacier National Park.

days.activity: Park exploration & camping

journal.title: Thurs 6/26
journal.content:
- Started Going-to-the-Sun Road at ~ 9:30 AM
- Couldn't get parking for Avalanche Lake Trail, continued on up mountains. Pulled over at every turn out available
- Got to Hidden Lake Overlook Trailhead. Much of the trail was covered in snow so it was very slow + slippery going up. We got to the lake + it was beautiful. On the way down it was very tricky cause if you slipped on the snow, you basically kept sliding down the mountain. Everyone was scared + going super slow, except Fenn, who was using their ski training to essentially ski down the mountain. I've never seen them so giddy.
- had diet coke + granola bars at the most gorgous overlook on the planet
- hiked through a dead forest (fire) to Benny Falls + Sun Point. There was a wedding happening at Sun Point! Finished Going-to-the-Sun Road @ 7:30 PM. Incredible day
- Trevor at GPL gave horrible advice: speed throu GTTS road so we can play mini golf in West Glacier
- kept running into 'Safety Mom' + her crew
- had a fun night hanging by the lake and camping

photos.title: Glacier National Park Arrival
photos.description: First day exploring the stunning alpine wilderness of Glacier National Park.

album.title: Sigur Ros - Untitled

map.title: Glacier National Park Entry
map.description: Arriving and setting up camp in the spectacular alpine wilderness of Glacier National Park.

days.activity: More park adventures & camping

journal.title: Fri 6/27
journal.content:
- got up early so we could get to Going-to-the-Sun road without a ticket - made it just in time (6:50 AM)
- got parking at Avalanche Lake Trail (last spot!)
- cool + drizzly weather, great for hiking. Lake was beautiful
- Fenn got a new outfit at Logan Pass. 'Explorer Fenn' has been unlocked
- tried to get to Many Glacier but construction/road closure made it impossible. still a pretty drive
- rented a kayak on Lake MacDonald, great view of the mountains
- got back to the camping site early + chilled / read books for a few hours + then went to bed early. After going non-stop for days, it was nice to rest

photos.title: Glacier Adventures Continue
photos.description: Second day of exploration in Glacier's pristine alpine wilderness and continued camping.

album.title: Turnstile - Never Enough

map.title: Glacier National Park Exploration
map.description: Deep exploration of Glacier's trails, Going-to-the-Sun Road, and alpine wilderness.

days.activity: Drive to Yellowstone & Old Faithful Inn

journal.title: Sat 6/28
journal.content:
- packed up early + left Glacier via the scenic route (past Seely Lake) that had been recommended to us
- drove to Garnet Ghost Town and learned about the gold rush. This looks more like Deadwood™ than Deadwood, SD did.
- tried to take a shortcut to I-90, got stuck on a very bumpy dirt road on the side of a clif. At one point, we had to back up and let another car through. I almost puked. We asked the ladies in the car if we were close to I-90 and they laughed in our faces. We had miles left to go. In hindsight, it was very funny and those ladies had every right to laugh at us. Fenn handled it well. If left to my own devices I'd still be stuck there
- vegan lunch in Missoula, thanks to James for the rec!
- Drove to Old Faithful Inn in Yellowstone. So amazing to see the geysers on the way in. We arrived just in time to see Old Faithful do her thing

photos.title: Yellowstone Arrival
photos.description: Journey from Glacier to Yellowstone and checking into the historic Old Faithful Inn.

album.title: Carly Rae Jepsen - E•MO•TION

map.title: Glacier to Yellowstone
map.description: Drive from Glacier National Park to Yellowstone and check-in at Old Faithful Inn.

days.activity: Park exploration (staying at inn)

journal.title: Sun 6/29
journal.content:
- started day with Mammoth Hot Springs
- drove to Lamar Valley (one of my favorite stops). In the east corner of the park, much less foot traffic than other places. Huge herds of bison, other wildlife. I loved this place, it felt more wild than anywhere I've ever been, like a reminder that we were wild before + can be again. But also we were told that some guy was eaten by a bear here a week before, so...
- Then we went to grab hot dog + chili + a 'huckleberry float'. It was so good.
- Also saw Artist Point at 'The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone'. Beautiful but crowded. Preferred the earlier turnout with amazing views + less people.
- Had dinner + drinks at Old Faithful Inn, got to watch Old Faithful blow again from the balcony bar. Tried to get to 5th Floor treefort area but was closed after an earthquake in the 1950s. Listened to violin player instead.

photos.title: Yellowstone Exploration
photos.description: Full day exploring Yellowstone's geysers, hot springs, and wildlife while staying at Old Faithful Inn.

album.title: Fenn's Top Apple Music Streams 2024 (lots of Hotline TNT, Smog, Charli XCX, MJ Lenderman)

map.title: Yellowstone National Park
map.description: Full exploration of Yellowstone's geysers, hot springs, and wildlife from Old Faithful Inn base.

days.activity: Morning Yellowstone, drive to Tetons

journal.title: Mon 6/30
journal.content:
- I got up early to go to the geysers before the crowds (6:30) I knew Grand Prismatic Spring would be packed later. It was so amazing to experience in solitude. The plumes of steam from the geysers was massive.
- got breakfast at Old Faithful Inn. Walked through the geyser basin at the hotel. Saw Old Faithful blow for a third time.
- went back to the geysers from this morning with Fenn. Grand Prismatic was _packed_. Fenn told some guy that it was illegal to be off the boardwalk (there were signs _everywhere_). I was proud of my little Mother Earth cop.
- Went to West Thumb geysers. _So_ pretty and way less crowded
- Drove into Grand Tetons. Gorgeous drive. Got to our campground and was told that there was a bear in the camp 10 days ago and he's been seen pacing outside the campsite. also there were 3 wolves on the other side of camp. also our site was literally too small for a tent. We looked up local hotels, saw it would cost $700 for 2 nights (lol, Jackson Hole), and decided to get a can of bear spray instead

photos.title: Yellowstone to Tetons
photos.description: Final Yellowstone morning and the scenic drive to the dramatic peaks of Grand Teton National Park.

album.title: Kurt Vile - Waking on a Pretty Daze

map.title: Yellowstone to Grand Teton
map.description: Final Yellowstone exploration and drive to Grand Teton National Park's dramatic mountain peaks.

days.activity: River rafting & wildflower photos!

journal.title: Tues 7/1
journal.content:
- hiked to Taggert Lake. Way harder than Alltrails claimed, but the view of mountains + lake were worth it
- did scenic drive
- easy hike at String + Leigh Lake. Pretty but didn't make it to the end. we passed a man on the trail and he said "hello" and kept walking. The woman he was with was a few paces behind and when we crossed paths she warned us there was a bear up ahead, I guess the man would have just let us get eaten.
- got lunch/dinner in Jackson Hole
- Did scenic float on Snake River at sunset. It was incredibly fun + beautiful. Fenn saw the first moose! Our guide said Fenn had a "good eye!" (Fenn asked that I include this detail). It was a magical way to end our Teton Day

photos.title: Tetons River and Wildflowers
photos.description: River rafting adventure and wildflower photography in the spectacular Grand Teton National Park.

album.title: Black Country, New Road - For the First Time

map.title: Grand Teton Adventures
map.description: River rafting on the Snake River and wildflower photography in Grand Teton National Park.

days.activity: Drive to Moab via Dinosaur Monument

journal.title: Wed 7/2
journal.content:
- woke up early. relieved to have had two uneventful nights in the campground sans bear or wolf attacks
- drove south to Flaming Gorge, UT, stopped for lunch + scenic views
- drove to Dinosaur National Monument
-- first stop in Jensen to go to awesome Fossil Museum with 2 story fossil wall. Did short but hot walk through fossil quarry -> super fun
-- drove to Colorado side (Dinosaur, CO) to drive scenic road w/ overlooks
- I drove the rest of the way to Moab, including up + over a mountain. The drive was very strange + beautiful through western CO
- Fenn thinks that Forrest Fenn hid his treasure somewhere near here

photos.title: Tetons to Desert
photos.description: Epic drive from Grand Teton to Moab via Dinosaur National Monument, transitioning from mountains to desert.

album.title: The Best of Sam Cooke

map.title: Tetons to Moab
map.description: Long drive from Grand Teton to Moab, Utah, with stop at Dinosaur National Monument.

days.activity: Lucky weather at Arches, Lin Ottinger's Rock Shop

journal.title: Thurs 7/3
journal.content:
- First day in Arches - had timed entry ticket for 8am. Got amazingly lucky with the weather, typically in July it is 100º + sunny, today was ~70º and overcast. We even had a little rain! Since it is supposed to heat up again tomorrow, we moved all our hikes today. we did:
-- Delicate Arch - so fun, so gorgeous, lived up to the hype. Fenn found it easier than I did, my lungs don't like this environment
-- Landscape Arch in Devil's Garden - so fun to walk through all the slabs
-- Sand Arch & Broken Arch - a little crowded but still fun
-- Park Avenue - started to heat up by this time but this hike was stunning
- After Arches, ate a big meal at Moab brewing, chilled that night
- Wen to Lin Ottinger's Rock Shop - most magical store in the world!

photos.title: Arches National Park Arrival
photos.description: First day exploring the incredible red rock arches and setting up camp in the Utah desert.

album.title: Gil Scott-Heron & Jamie XX - We're New Here

map.title: Arches National Park
map.description: Arriving and camping at Arches National Park with its incredible red rock formations.

days.activity: Double Arches, Canyonlands sunset, Moab fireworks

journal.title: Fri 7/4
journal.content:
- Spent the morning in Arches doing all the overlooks + short hikes we didn't do yesterday. Our favorite was the Double Arches.
- Got lunch at the court of food trucks
- Chilled at the campsite during during the hottest part of the day (>90º)
- That night we did a bunch of overlooks in Canyonland National Park, it was golden hour then sunset. We were in the 'Island in the Sky' part of the park. Much less crowded than Arches today, then chased the sunset for awhile. The canyons turned an incredible purple color.
- Then we got some late night Mexican food back in Moab. People were setting off fireworks all over town for the 4th

photos.title: July 4th Desert Celebration
photos.description: Celebrating Independence Day exploring Arches National Park and camping in the red rock desert.

album.title: The Smashing Pumpkins - Mellon Collie and the Infinite Sadness

map.title: July 4th Arches Exploration
map.description: Independence Day exploration of Arches National Park's most famous formations.

days.activity: Salt Flats, In N Out, Hyatt luxury, Handle restaurant with Sam

journal.title: Sat 7/5
journal.content:
- Drove from Moab to the Bonneville Salt Flats. Not much to do out there but the scenery was beautiful + strange + it was fun to take photos out there.
- We both agreed that the 5 hours felt longer than the 8, 10, 12 hour driving days we have been doing. Must mean its time for this road trip to come to an end.
- Surprised to find In N Out here, grabbed some animal style burgers + fries while on the road
- checked into the Hyatt in SLC. After camping + random airbnbs, it felt so luxurious
- notable weird encounter: the aggro man in the elevator who somehow grabbed his wife's ass at us?
- Drove to Park City to eat at 'Handle', Fenn's friend Sam (aka Taters) from high school is the head chef there. The food + service was _amazing_. We had personalized menus with our names on them. Sam brought out _5_ free apps for us (sour cream + onion dip with caviar, scallops in a lime curry sauce, soft shell crab, duck confit, and bok choy with pork belly)! It was all incredible and we ate til we almost exploded.

photos.title: Bonneville Salt Flats
photos.description: Exploring the otherworldly white expanse of the Bonneville Salt Flats and drive to Salt Lake City.

album.title: Ian Whitcomb's Mod, Mod Music Hall!

map.title: Bonneville Salt Flats
map.description: Exploring the Bonneville Salt Flats and drive to Salt Lake City for final Utah night.

days.activity: Laundry, couples massage, Lake Effect, Temple Square, Grizzlies players

journal.title: Sun 7/6
journal.content:
- Our final day! Mixed feelings cause we're so tired and we miss home, but also have had an unbelievable journey.
- Today we got up, did a bunch of laundry at the laundromat, took Monks' car to the car wash + cleaned + vacuumed the inside. Then we did a couple's massage to treat ourselves. We both had a lot of knots to work out after sleeping on the ground, excercising, and driving for 10 hours at a a time.
- Dinner was at the bar that Sam recommended, 'Lake Effect'. The place was built in 1910 and they have a crazy cocktail menu + floor to ceiling shelves of booze with a Beauty and the Beast style ladder
- Went to Temple Square. The Mormon Temple was covered in scaffolding but we got to see the admin building, Relief Society, and the controversial City Creek Mall that houses Desert Books, among other things
- rode in the elevator with 2 players from the NBA team the Memphis Grizzlies! they were very polite!

photos.title: Salt Lake City Farewell
photos.description: Final day exploring Salt Lake City and preparing for the journey home after 20 incredible days.

album.title: Whatever the calming music at the spa was

map.title: Salt Lake City
map.description: Final day exploring Salt Lake City and preparing for departure after the 20-day adventure.

days.activity: Monks key handoff, flying home after 20 amazing days

journal.title: Mon 7/7
journal.content:
- Coming Home! Had breakfast at the hotel, packed all our stuff (4 bags each!!) + headed to the airport
- The key handoff to Monks went very smoothly. Amazingly nice of him to let us borrow the truck AND fly to SLC to drive it back to Chicago

photos.title: Journey Complete
photos.description: Flying home after completing our incredible 20-day cross-country honeymoon adventure.

album.title: Diarrhea Planet - I'm Rich Beyond Your Wildest Dreams

map.title: Salt Lake City to Home
map.description: Final flight home, completing the incredible 20-day cross-country honeymoon journey.
